title: Myers-Briggs Personality Type Indicator (MBTI) Assessment
subtitle: Discover your unique personality type and gain insights into your preferences and behaviors
description: This comprehensive MBTI assessment evaluates your preferences across four key dimensions: Extraversion vs. Introversion (E/I), Sensing vs. Intuition (S/N), Thinking vs. Feeling (T/F), and Judging vs. Perceiving (J/P). Based on Carl Jung's theory of psychological types, developed by Isabel Briggs Myers and Katharine Cook Briggs, it assigns one of 16 personality types. The quiz consists of 32 questions (8 per dimension) with a 4-point scale. Results are determined by summing scores per dimension (range 8-32, threshold at 20) and combining preferences. Note: This is for self-discovery and not a professional diagnosis. For accurate results, answer honestly based on your typical behavior.

questions.text: I am energized by spending time with other people.
I prefer to socialize in large groups rather than one-on-one.
I enjoy being the center of attention.
I am comfortable initiating conversations with strangers.
I prefer lively environments over quiet ones.
I feel drained after prolonged solitude.
I thrive in team-based activities.
I seek out social events regularly.
I focus on facts and details rather than possibilities.
I prefer practical solutions over innovative ones.
I trust my five senses more than my intuition.
I like step-by-step instructions when learning new things.
I am more interested in what is happening now than what might happen in the future.
I value hands-on experience over theoretical knowledge.
I prefer concrete examples to abstract concepts.
I describe myself as realistic and down-to-earth.
I make decisions based on logic and objective analysis.
I prioritize truth and fairness over maintaining harmony.
I am more objective than subjective when evaluating situations.
I analyze pros and cons systematically before deciding.
I am firm in my principles, even if it upsets others.
I value justice and consistency over compassion in conflicts.
I remain detached and rational when making tough choices.
I focus more on tasks and outcomes than on people's feelings.
I like to have a detailed plan and stick to it rigidly.
I prefer structure, organization, and clear routines in my life.
I make decisions quickly to achieve closure.
I like to complete one task fully before starting another.
I am punctual and dislike last-minute changes.
I feel uncomfortable with surprises and prefer predictability.
I set clear goals, deadlines, and schedules for myself.
I dislike loose ends and prefer everything resolved promptly.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ISTJ
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Inspector
recommendations: Pursue careers in law or accounting

proposedBlogPosts.title: The Power of Structure for ISTJs

complexGradingCriteria.description: Practical, fact-minded, responsible, and reliable. ISTJs value tradition and order, excelling in roles requiring detail and structure.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ISFJ
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Protector
complexGradingCriteria.description: Conscientious, caring, and dedicated to helping others. ISFJs are loyal and supportive, often thriving in nurturing professions.

complexGradingCriteria.name: INFJ
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Advocate
complexGradingCriteria.description: Insightful, idealistic, and driven by values. INFJs seek meaning and connection, often in creative or counseling fields.

complexGradingCriteria.name: INTJ
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Architect
complexGradingCriteria.description: Strategic, innovative, and independent thinkers. INTJs plan meticulously and excel in complex problem-solving.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ISTP
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Crafter
complexGradingCriteria.description: Bold, practical, and analytical explorers. ISTPs enjoy hands-on work and troubleshooting.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ISFP
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Artist
complexGradingCriteria.description: Sensitive, kind, and artistic individuals. ISFPs live in the moment and value harmony.

complexGradingCriteria.name: INFP
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Mediator
complexGradingCriteria.description: Poetic, altruistic, and guided by principles. INFPs seek authenticity and help others.

complexGradingCriteria.name: INTP
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Thinker
complexGradingCriteria.description: Innovative, logical, and curious intellectuals. INTPs love theories and debate.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ESTP
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Persuader
complexGradingCriteria.description: Energetic, action-oriented, and adaptable. ESTPs thrive on excitement and quick thinking.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ESFP
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Performer
complexGradingCriteria.description: Outgoing, fun-loving, and spontaneous. ESFPs bring joy and connect easily.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ENFP
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Champion
complexGradingCriteria.description: Enthusiastic, creative, and people-oriented. ENFPs inspire and innovate.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ENTP
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Debater
complexGradingCriteria.description: Clever, visionary, and argumentative. ENTPs challenge norms and ideate.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ESTJ
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Director
complexGradingCriteria.description: Efficient, organized, and decisive leaders. ESTJs enforce standards and achieve goals.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ESFJ
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Caregiver
complexGradingCriteria.description: Warm, cooperative, and sociable. ESFJs foster harmony and support.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ENFJ
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Giver
complexGradingCriteria.description: Charismatic, empathetic, and inspirational. ENFJs motivate and guide others.

complexGradingCriteria.name: ENTJ
complexGradingCriteria.label: The Commander
recommendations: Excel in executive or consulting roles
complexGradingCriteria.description: Bold, strategic, and ambitious leaders. ENTJs drive change and efficiency.
